1.title: Nikolai Radev: The Invader

episode of.title: Tough Nuts: Australia's Hardest Criminals (TV Series 2010– )

1.plot: Radev invaded the lives of his extortion victims and terrorized them until they met his demands. Children, wives, family members were dragged in to his world of violence and horror. No one was safe.

2.title: Ray Denning: The Runner

episode of.title: Tough Nuts: Australia's Hardest Criminals (TV Series 2010– )

2.plot: Brutal killer, armed robber, heartbreaker and prison escapologist, Ray was the ultimate anti-hero who spent his whole life running from the nightmares in his head.

3.title: Tilly Devine: Madam Razor

episode of.title: Tough Nuts: Australia's Hardest Criminals (TV Series 2010– )

3.plot: Tilly was a drug dealing brothel madam, a criminal sociopath and Sydney's Queen of vice, who clawed her way to the top of the city's sex trade with a razor in her hand. Tilly Devine was a prostitute who founded a criminal empire on the mean streets of Sydney after the First World War.

5.title: Jockey Smith

episode of.title: Tough Nuts: Australia's Hardest Criminals (TV Series 2010– )

5.plot: Criminal lunatic, gunman, arch-thief and armed robber, Jockey Smith terrorized Australia at gunpoint for three decades. When confronted, the short angry guy with a bad case of small man syndrome invariably reached for a gun.

6.title: Dino Dibra: The Sunshine Boy

episode of.title: Tough Nuts: Australia's Hardest Criminals (TV Series 2010– )

6.plot: Multiple murderer, drug dealer, kidnapper, extortionist and street hoon, Dino Dibra grew up in Sunshine - a tough working class suburb where he became lifelong friends with a group of boys at school who would all go on to make their marks in Melbourne's underworld.

7.title: Stewart John Regan: The Magician

episode of.title: Tough Nuts: Australia's Hardest Criminals (TV Series 2010– )

7.plot: Multiple murderer, extortionist, pimp, child killer and violent thug, Regan is arguably the most violent and terrifying person in Australian criminal history. A genuine psychopath, Regan spent his childhood in rural New South Wales torturing animals.

8.title: George Freeman: The King of Sydney

episode of.title: Tough Nuts: Australia's Hardest Criminals (TV Series 2010– )

8.plot: Murderer, standover man, race fixer, SP bookmaker and crime lord, George Freeman was the King of Sydney for over three decades. His skills as a gambler and race fixer meant he could enrich his associates and a growing band of influential people who helped keep him out of trouble with police.

1.title: Chris Flannery: The Man Called Rentakill

episode of.title: Tough Nuts: Australia's Hardest Criminals (TV Series 2010– )

1.plot: Christopher Dale Flannery earned the nickname of 'Rent-a-kill'. He was a hit man and gun for hire who would kill anyone if the price was right. Find out about the man who killed in cold blood before returning to his home to smother his children with affection and dote after his wife, Kathleen.

2.title: Chow Hayes: Australia's First Gangster

episode of.title: Tough Nuts: Australia's Hardest Criminals (TV Series 2010– )

2.plot: Arguably Australia's most feared gangster, Frederick 'Chow' Hayes was a convicted double murderer, sentenced to hang in 1952 for the brazen killing of standoverman and former boxer, Bobby Lee.

3.title: Alphonse Gangitano: The Black Prince of Lygon Street

episode of.title: Tough Nuts: Australia's Hardest Criminals (TV Series 2010– )

3.plot: Alphonse Gangitano was known as the Black Prince of Lygon Street and was the most lethal member of Melbourne's notorious Carlton Crew in the 1980s and 1990s. Through a series of re-enactments of the most significant events in Gangitano's life, relive the rise and fall of the Melbourne crime tsar.

4.title: Dennis Allen: Mr Death

episode of.title: Tough Nuts: Australia's Hardest Criminals (TV Series 2010– )

4.plot: Dennis Allen was the oldest son of Melbourne crime matriarch, Kath Pettingill. While the remainder of her sons are criminals and some of them vicious killers, not one comes close to the utter brutality of Dennis Allen.

5.title: Russell Cox: Australia's Most Wanted Man

episode of.title: Tough Nuts: Australia's Hardest Criminals (TV Series 2010– )

5.plot: Meet Australia's most wanted man for a record 11 years. Russell 'Mad Dog' Cox was a man no prison could hold. He escaped from New South Wales' notorious 'electronic zoo', the maximum security Katingal jail - the jail the politicians had said was escape proof.

6.title: Mick Sayers: The Gambler

episode of.title: Tough Nuts: Australia's Hardest Criminals (TV Series 2010– )

6.plot: Michael 'Melbourne Mick' Sayers was a run of the mill crook who got in too deep with some of the tough nuts in Sydney's organized crime scene. An associate and friend of Chris Flannery, Sayers ventured to Sydney and discovered that to survive on the mean streets, he had to turn his hand to drug dealing, extortion, race rigging and murder.

7.title: Ray Bennett: The Criminal Mastermind

episode of.title: Tough Nuts: Australia's Hardest Criminals (TV Series 2010– )

7.plot: Raymond 'Ray Chuck' Bennett was Australia's criminal mastermind. A brazen armed robber and thief, he did the jobs that other criminals considered were beyond them. His most audacious robbery was The Great Bookie Robbery - a heist at the Australian Jockey Club while the bookies met to settle up from the weekend's trade.

8.title: Lennie McPherson: Mr Big

episode of.title: Tough Nuts: Australia's Hardest Criminals (TV Series 2010– )

8.plot: Lennie McPherson ruled the Sydney crime scene for four decades. He was a violent and vicious criminal and arguably the worst of the worst. Trace the rise and fall of Lennie McPherson from a street crook in the 1940s to the Mr. Big of the organized crime scene in Australia and to his death behind bars.

imdb.plot outline: Documentary/drama about famous criminals of Australia. Featuring interviews of people still alive that we're involved during that era. featuring former New south wales detective Roger Rogerson and Mark brandon (chopper) read presented by a Tara moss
